intro: Isopogon trilobus var. tridens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces bright red or orange flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is typically found in heathlands and coastal regions, thriving in well-drained sandy soils. This species is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in its native habitat.
